intro: Medica apiculata, commonly known as the sharp-tipped medica, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, pointed leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are borne in clusters and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Medica apiculata is also valued for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
